title: BBC Local Live: Coventry & Warwickshire on Monday 20 June 2016 - BBC News

jlr finance chief side in eu referendum .
officer assaulted in 'acid ' attack recognised at police bravery awards .
leamington and kenilworth homes 'too expensive ' for government 's help to buy scheme .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 're back at 08:00 on tuesday with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather , but keep an eye out here for updates through the evening and into the morning .

documents.title: coming up on tv
text: a businessman says he 's so fed up with the police response to his company being repeatedly burgled , he 's planning to move out of birmingham .
and jaguar land rover has become the latest major firm in our region to write to its staff today about its stance on the eu referendum .
more on these stories and others on bbc midlands today at 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Mary Rhodes
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: proud coleshill headteacher says 'good ' ofsted rating is 'just the start '
text: a coleshill school has been rated as 'good ' by inspectors for the first time in more than two decades .
author: Atherstone & Coleshill Herald

documents.title: where mps stand on the eu referendum debate
text: if you 'd like to know whether your local mp backs the leave or remain campaign , there 's a handy tool to check by either postcode or constituency here .

documents.title: 'i felt like it was eating my face away '
text: a warwickshire police officer who had a chemical thrown in her face when she tried to stop a burglary is to get a bravery award .
constable sara skinner was attacked in lillington , leamington spa , in april 2015 .
she said the burning `` felt like it was eating my face away '' .

documents.title: jlr finance chief side in eu referendum
text: jaguar land rover 's chief financial officer , ken gregor , said a remain vote would increase the firm 's chances to `` grow , create jobs and attract investment in future technologies '' .
he joined other leading figures in the british car industry in backing a vote to remain in the european union , including 77 % of firms in the society of motor manufacturers and traders .

meanwhile , leave-supporting john longworth , former british chambers of commerce director general , told the bbc radio 4 today programme : `` the auto industry is different from the rest of industry in the sense that it has a 10 % tariff for cars from outside the eu . ''

he added : `` the biggest power in the eu - germany - exports way more cars to the uk than we do to them , so they are not going to allow the erection of tariffs because they would damage their own industry and shoot themselves in the foot . ''

documents.title: watch : latest weather for coventry and warwickshire

author: Kay Crewdson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman dies in moreton morrell crash
text: a woman has died after the car she was driving left the road and hit a tree yesterday morning on the fosse way at moreton morrell , the ambulance service says .
a young boy , who was also in the car , was treated for minor injuries and taken to hospital in coventry .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: watch : coventry motorcycles 'essential ' for somme communications
text: this year marks the 100th anniversary of the battle of the somme , one of the bloodiest campaigns in the first world war .
thousands of men from coventry and warwickshire fought in the conflict , while factories in the city made the weapons and machines used in the battle .
communications were often carried out by messengers riding one of the 30,000 triumph model h bikes , all of which were made in coventry .
elizabeth chard-cooper from the coventry transport museum explains why they were so loved by their riders .
author: Alec Blackman
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: travel : a444 accident
text: one lane is blocked on a444 southbound in bedworth between the sutherland drive junction and nuneaton because of an accident .
more details on bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: veteran takes part in armed forces day ceremony
text: world war ii veteran , cecil jeffcoate from bulkington , joined members of the council today to launch warwickshire 's armed forces day celebrations .
the 93-year-old , who took part in the normandy landings and was recently awarded the legion d'honneur , hoisted the armed forces day flag .
cecil , who was 21 at the time of the normandy operation , arrived as back-up at pegasus bridge , just hours after it had been taken from german forces .
he said i remember that time as if it was yesterday - we were hanging on by our fingernails , but we held the ground and eventually pushed the germans back . ''

documents.title: women 's tour winner thanks thousands who turned out to support race
text: an estimated 70,000 turned out to watch the women 's tour stage through warwickshire , including 6,000 school children and 30,000 from outside the county .
lizzie armitstead is the first british rider to win the tour .

documents.title: warning after bmw poses as police vehicle to stop other cars
text: a driver has been using his bmw to pose as a police car and try to force other motorists off the road .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: daughter says councillor would have 'cooperated fully ' over fraud investigation
text: more now on former coventry council deputy leader , the late philip townshend , and the fact he was subject to a police investigation over an allegation of fraud but never questioned by officers .
his daughter , 26-year-old kirstie logan-townshend , rejected the allegation and said police `` made a mistake '' by not interviewing him before his death as `` he would have cooperated fully '' .
ms logan-townshend said : `` if police had not investigated , they would have faced scrutiny because he was a public figure .
they raided my home as well .
`` i knew all his sides and this allegation would have been completely out of character . ''
author: Alex Homer
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : coventry to nuneaton rail line blocked
text: a faulty train has closed the line between coventry and nuneaton , says london midland .
a replacement bus service will run both ways until at least 16:00 .
new : due to a fault on train between coventry & nuneaton all lines disrupted .
disruption expected til 16:00 & replacement transport ordered .

documents.title: midsummer : 24-hour shakespeare
text: our friends at shakespeare lives are celebrating the longest day of the bard 's 400th anniversary year by finding out about midsummer 's significance - and how he would have marked the hours .
you can follow their live updates here .

documents.title: andy sullivan joint best-placed brit at us open
text: nuneaton golfer andy sullivan finished seven over in the us open - which was won by dunstin johnson in his first major win .
sullivan finished joint 23rd , alongside british player chris wood , and says he 's now concentrating on his next international open at lärchenhof near cologne later this month .

documents.title: jlr speaks out over eu referendum
text: coventry-based car maker jaguar land rover today joined other car manufactures by writing to their employees about the eu referendum .
the car company says it believes that remaining in the eu is better for the industry and will safeguard hundreds of jobs .
recently , lord bamford , chairman of the staffordshire-based digger-maker jcb , wrote to his 6,000 workers urging them to vote leave .
you can read more on our eu referendum page .

documents.title: county championship : lancashire v warwickshire due to start
text: the toss has been uncontested at old trafford and warwickshire have chosen to bowl first when play starts at 14:00 .
lancashire hand a debut to 19-year-old leg-spinner matt parkinson .
live updates can be found here .
news from the toss is that there has not been a toss .

BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: homes 'too expensive ' for help to buy isa scheme
text: leamington spa and kenilworth are among the areas in which would-be homeowners are being priced out of a government scheme to help first-time buyers , a bbc investigation has found .
the help to buy individual savings account ( htb isa ) was introduced last year to help people save for a home .
in both areas the average price of a starter home exceeds the maximum purchase cap of £ 250,000 , or £ 450,000 in london .
the average starter home in leamington is £ 257,492 and kenilworth is £ 258,453 .
find out whether the help to buy isa supports people in your area with our postcode search tool .

documents.title: 'acid attack ' pc to be recognised for bravery
text: a warwickshire police officer who had `` acid '' thrown in her face when she tried to stop a gang of burglary suspects has been nominated for a police bravery award .
pc sara skinner was patrolling alone in leamington spa last april when she challenged four men who were trying to break into a house .
they attacked her and poured a hazardous liquid - later identified as ammonium hydroxide - onto her face and eyes .
she 's due to be recognised at a ceremony in london next month .

documents.title: warwickshire vigil held for jo cox mp
text: residents of north warwickshire gathered at coleshill parish church last night for a vigil to remember jo cox mp who was killed in her constituency in west yorkshire on thursday .
mps from coventry and warwickshire will join others in westminster today to remember mrs cox in parliament before a short memorial service at st margaret 's church .

documents.title: body found in search for missing man
text: a body found in coventry on saturday is believed to be that of missing coventry man julian kulpa , say police .
the 52-year-old was reported missing from his city home on wednesday .
officers say they found the body in woodland off brinklow road in binley and the death is n't being treated as sus

documents.title: 'arise , fair sun ' : shakespeare celebrates summer solstice
text: if you were n't up to watch the sun rise on the summer solstice - or maybe could n't see it through the drizzle - here 's another chance to enjoy ashley walters welcome the longest day as romeo .
it 's sunrise on the longest day in the uk .
`` arise , fair sun , and kill the envious moon '' @ twitterid # midsummer

documents.title: women 's tour : lizzie armitstead wins race for first time
text: lizzie armitstead has won the women 's tour for the first time .
warwickshire hosted a stage of the race last week .
the 27-year-old world road race champion , riding for the boels dolmans team , finished in the pack to preserve her 11-second lead on south africa 's ashleigh moolman-pasio .
`` i feel very lucky because i am part of a country that loves cycling at the moment , '' armitstead said .
`` i hope that bubble continues .
events like this certainly help .
@ l armitstead tells us she feels 'lucky ' to be first british rider to win women 's tour & is very proud # avivawt2016
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: fraud probe councillor never quizzed
text: an ex-deputy council leader accused of ripping off a vulnerable woman was never interviewed by police over the allegation , the bbc has learned .
coventry councillor philip townshend , who died last year , took out a mortgage on the elderly woman 's house without her knowledge , a source said .
a relative branded the police inquiry `` disgraceful '' .
west midlands police defended its investigation but declined to say why no interview took place .
author: Alex Homer
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : latest weather for coventry and warwickshire
text: a cloudy , mild and muggy start to the day with outbreaks of showery rain pushing up from the south through the morning ; heavy and persistent at times .
this will clear away into the afternoon to leave drier and brighter conditions to end the day with top temperatures of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Kay Crewdson
Weather presenter

documents.title: new bridge opens at tollbar end
text: a new bridge has opened , in time for the morning traffic , at coventry 's tollbar island .
traffic on the eastern side of the roundabout will now move off the existing carriageway and onto the adjacent new bridge .
highways england says the new bridge will help reduce queuing on the approach and brings them .
`` a step closer to completion '' .
east side of tollbar bridge opened at 6am this morning

we 'll bring you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates throughout the day .
